statements: SELECT * FROM VirtualTeamsHRInfo WHERE id = 1;
SELECT benefit_name, benefit_details FROM VirtualTeamsHRInfo WHERE id = 2;
SELECT policy_name, policy_description FROM VirtualTeamsHRInfo WHERE id = 3;
SELECT * FROM VirtualTeamsHRInfo WHERE policy_name = 'Health Insurance';
SELECT id, policy_name, benefit_name FROM VirtualTeamsHRInfo WHERE id = 4;
SELECT * FROM VirtualTeamsHRInfo WHERE policy_name = 'Vacation Policy';
SELECT id, policy_name, benefit_name FROM VirtualTeamsHRInfo WHERE id = 3;
SELECT * FROM VirtualTeamsHRInfo WHERE policy_description LIKE '%health%';
SELECT id, benefit_name FROM VirtualTeamsHRInfo WHERE benefit_name IS NOT NULL ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT id, policy_name, policy_description FROM VirtualTeamsHRInfo WHERE id BETWEEN 2 AND 5;
SELECT * FROM policies;
SELECT policy_name, policy_description FROM policies WHERE policy_id = 1;
SELECT policy_id, policy_name FROM policies ORDER BY policy_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM benefits WHERE benefit_amount > 500.00;
SELECT benefit_name, benefit_description FROM benefits WHERE benefit_id = 3;
SELECT * FROM policies WHERE policy_id = 1;
SELECT policy_name, policy_description FROM policies WHERE policy_name LIKE '%health%';
SELECT benefit_name, benefit_description, benefit_amount FROM benefits WHERE benefit_amount > 1000;
SELECT policy_id, policy_name, policy_description FROM policies ORDER BY policy_id DESC;
SELECT policies.policy_id, policies.policy_name, benefits.benefit_name, benefits.benefit_amount FROM policies JOIN benefits ON policies.policy_id = benefits.benefit_id;
SELECT * FROM policies;
SELECT policy_id, policy_name FROM policies ORDER BY policy_id DESC;

SELECT * FROM benefits WHERE benefit_type = 'Medical' ORDER BY benefit_amount DESC;

SELECT policy_name, policy_description FROM policies ORDER BY policy_name DESC;
SELECT benefit_name, benefit_type, benefit_amount FROM benefits WHERE benefit_amount > 1000 ORDER BY benefit_amount;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE employee_position LIKE '%Manager%';
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE employee_department = 'IT' AND employee_salary > 50000 ORDER BY employee_salary DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT first_name, last_name, role FROM employees WHERE role='Manager';

SELECT id, first_name, last_name, role, hire_date FROM employees ORDER BY hire_date DESC;

SELECT first_name, last_name FROM employees ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT team_id, COUNT(employee_id) AS num_employees FROM team_members GROUP BY team_id HAVING num_employees > 2;

SELECT policy_name, policy_description FROM policies;

SELECT employee_name, position, team_name FROM employee_data INNER JOIN teams ON employee_data.team_id = teams.team_id;
